improvement_list.improvement_desc: The initial value of `min_length` is set to `n + 1`. This is unnecessary and can be simplified to `n` since the minimum length cannot exceed the length of the input array.

The code checks if `min_length` equals `n + 1` to determine if a solution was found.  This can be simplified by directly assigning `min_length` to `answer` and using a ternary operation to handle both cases.

The while loop condition `current_sum >= target` might lead to an infinite loop if `nums` contains only non-negative numbers and `target` is smaller than the sum of any subset of `nums`. Add a check to break the loop if the `right` reaches the end of `nums`.
